implementation.name: read_tasks
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: API endpoint to retrieve all tasks. Supports the UI in displaying the list of tasks, including their completion status.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Define GET /tasks endpoint
    Call get_tasks() from database
    Return the list of tasks

implementation.name: create_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: API endpoint to add a new task. Receives task data (title, description, priority, due date) and delegates creation to the database layer.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Define POST /tasks endpoint
    Receive TaskCreate object from request
    Call add_task(task) from database
    Return the created task

implementation.name: add_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Handles the logic for adding a new task. Generates a unique ID, saves the task, and persists it to storage.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Get all tasks
Create new Task with unique id and provided fields
Append new task to tasks list
Save tasks to file
Return new task

implementation.name: update_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: API endpoint to edit an existing task. Receives updated task data and delegates update to the database layer.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Define PUT /tasks/{task_id} endpoint
    Receive task_id and TaskCreate object
    Call update_task(task_id, task) from database
    If no task found, raise 404 error
    Return updated task

implementation.name: update_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Handles the logic for updating an existing task. Finds the task by ID, updates its fields, and saves changes.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Get all tasks
For each task in tasks:
    If task.id == task_id:
        Create updated Task with new data
        Replace old task with updated task
        Save tasks to file
        Return updated task
If not found, return None

implementation.name: delete_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: API endpoint to delete a task. Delegates deletion to the database layer.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Define DELETE /tasks/{task_id} endpoint
    Receive task_id
    Call delete_task(task_id) from database
    If not found, raise 404 error
    Return success message

implementation.name: delete_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Handles the logic for deleting a task. Removes the task by ID and saves the updated list.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Get all tasks
Filter out task with matching id
If a task was removed:
    Save tasks to file
    Return True
Else:
    Return False
